The B(OMgCl) 3-based electrolytes are expected to not cause the corrosive behavior. According to a previous study using MgCl 2/AlCl 3 electrolytes, the AlCl 2 + species cause Mg corrosion with Al cementation
51 . However, our 27Al NMR analysis (Fig. 7(a)) indicated that the B(OMgCl) 3 electrolytes do not contain AlCl 2 +. Other detected species were solvated [Mg 2(μ-Cl) 3] +, glyme-solvated Mg 2+, and AlCl 4 −, which reportedly do not cause corrosions.
